description.narrative: The objective of the Education Sector Project of the Democratic Republic of Congo is to prevent further deterioration in the delivery of essential services for primary education and prepare ground for a sustainable development and financing of the sector that will facilitate donor coordination and future transition to a sector wide program. There are 4 components to the Project. Component 1 will increase access and equity at primary level by providing resources to reduce the cost of education to households (reduce primary school fees) and rehabilitating 1570 classrooms which will boost the demand for and supply of education. Component 2 will Improve the quality of primary education by providing textbooks in mathematics and reading for every pupil in grades 1-2 of primary school, and by creating research capacity to assess and monitor quality of education which is instrumental to future quality improvement. Component 3 is to strengthen the capacity for policy planning, budgeting and program execution in pivotal areas for the sector including teacher career structure and teacher training, and the development of a sector wide medium term strategy for education. Component 4 will strengthen project management and coordination of the Steering Committee comprised of the Ministry of Primary, Secondary and Professional Education (MEPSP), the Ministry of Higher Education and Universities (MESU), the Ministry of Social Affairs and National Solidarity (MASSN), the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Budget with an increment in resources required to operate a Project Management and Coordination Unit (PMCU).

condition.narrative: No later than December 31, 2010 or such other date as may be agreed with the Association, carry out jointly with the Association,aMTR of the progress made in carrying out the Project and overall Project performance against Project performance indicators.

The Recipient shall have an annual audit of the delivery of funds for each TSPST Installment under Part A.3 (b) of the Projectcarried out according to terms and reference satisfactory to the Association as set forth in the Project Manual, by auditorsacceptable to the Association, after sixth (6th) TSPST Installment has been executed for that fiscal year.

The Recipient shall have an audit of the payment of each TPSOC under Part A.3 (c) of the Project carried out according to termsandreference satisfactory to the Association as set forth in the Project Manual, by auditors acceptable to the Association, nolater than seven (7) months after the payment of each such TPSOC.

The Recipient shall have its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the GeneralConditions. Each audit of the Financial Statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year of the Recipient. The auditedFinancial Statements for each period shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after the end of such period.

Without limitation on the provisions of Part A of this Section, the Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association notlater than forty five days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim unaudited financial reports for the Project covering thequarter, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

title.narrative: Utility of the learning assessment system

comment.narrative: A partnership agreement was signed between MEPS and PASEC and led to the increase of the school sample of the learning evaluationsurvey. Preliminary results are expected by end December 2010

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Most schools in public sector have no teacher guide
revised to show that each teacher has 2 guides (one in mathematics and one in French)
Target Met: each teacher has a guide in Mathematics and in French
Most schools in public sector have no textooks
each student to have one French and one math textbook.
Target met: each student has a math and French textbook)

title.narrative: Inspectors and school advisors receiving in-service training in the use of textbooks

comment.narrative: Target Met: 100% of inspectors and advisers trained

title.narrative: Girls to boys ratio in primary schools

comment.narrative: Target has been rectified (see comment under Actual reported on 03/02/2012

title.narrative: NEW - Education facilities built and/or rehabilitated (units)

comment.narrative: Indicator is monitored through the core indicator on classroooms
Monitoring of this indicator is done through the core indicator.
Target Far Surpassed: A major Project success

title.narrative: Growth in the gross enrolment ratio (GER).
Education sector strategy (including medium term financing plan) with indicators agreed with donors and approved by Government.

baseline.value: Consensus on priority for primary education (obligatory and fee free) but no common strategy for rest of education sector.

target.value: Sector Strategy developed and approved by Government and donors.

actual.value: Sector Strategy developed and approved by Government and Donors

title.narrative: Convention of partnerships revised and implemented
Loi cadre (organic law) is transmitted to Parliament for adoption
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Primary teachers in "registered" schools integrated into the public payroll

comment.narrative: under the project, the target of 20,155 teachers as agreed at project restructuring in 2011 has been reached.

title.narrative: New school construction norms are adopted for application of cost-effective school construction strategy
A textbook policy adopted by the Government

comment.narrative: There is a preliminary draft that is under discussion among the various technical directions of the ministry. This action is nowassumed under the new project PROSEB

title.narrative: Parents finding the school fee in primary education has been reduced
A draft teacher careeer structure (training, deployment, salary and incentives) approved by the Government
Basic education interim development plan is implemented according to agreed plan
Reformed guidelines for pre-service teacher training are developed and are applied
Based on lessons learnt from CRC and PETS, an action plan is put in place for an eventual scale up
CRC and PETS have been piloted in selected educational provinces

actual.value: PETS carried out; CRC still under development
